subject: When code refuses to be mocked
msgSnippet: I m having trouble testing some code that sits on top of a 3rd party library. Think Spring JDBC only instead of JDBC, it s a proprietary API to an obscure
messageBody:
I'm having trouble testing some code that sits on top of a 3rd party library.

Think "Spring JDBC" only instead of JDBC, it's a proprietary API to an
obscure database [1]. I'm coming back to this project after several
months, so if I'm not making sense it's because I've forgotten some
details. Please point that out and I'll re-learn and clarify.

Where I seem to have gotten stuck is that with EasyMock Class
Extension, I tried this:

// set up the mock UniFile
ctrlUniFile = MockClassControl.createControl(UniFile.class, null, null);
mockUniFile = (UniFile) ctrlUniSession.getMock();

And I get:

net.sf.cglib.core.CodeGenerationException: asjava.uniobjects.UniFileException-->
Cannot instantiate this object in this manner. Must use the UniSession object

The UniSession object is analogous to a Connection. I'm trying to
avoid having to connect to the database to test the 'Spring UOJ'
framework code. All I need to know is that it called the read method
on a UniFile, and got something back.

The test class and stack trace are here:
http://wiki.wsmoak.net/cgi-bin/wiki.pl?SpringUOJ/Test

Any ideas, or do you see anything I'm doing wrong?

After this, it looks like I started to write concrete 'MockUniSession'
and 'MockUniFile' classes. Before I continue down that path (or
continue wandering aimlessly) I thought I'd ask for help.

[1] UniObjects for Java and IBM's UniData, respectively.

Thanks,
--
Wendy
